thread.title: YouTube cooking sensation Auntie Fee 'fighting for her life' after suffering heart attack
thread.title_full: YouTube cooking sensation Auntie Fee 'fighting for her life' after suffering heart attack

author: Zoe Shenton
title: YouTube cooking sensation Auntie Fee 'fighting for her life' after suffering heart attack
text:
YouTube cooking sensation Auntie Fee 'fighting for her life' after suffering heart attack The 59-year-old is said to be on life support Share Auntie Fee is said to have suffered a heart attack (Photo: Getty/Los Angeles Times) Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
YouTube cooking sensation Auntie Fee is reportedly fighting for her life after suffering a heart attack. 
TMZ reports that she’s on life support surrounded by her family at Harbor-UCLA Medical Centre in Los Angeles after being taken there by ambulance. 
Auntie Fee, real name Felicia O'Dell, is best known for how to cook on a budget and her ‘sweet a** chicken’ and ‘dumb good mac and cheese’. 
The 59-year-old first became a viral sensation back in 2014 and has since garnered hundreds of thousands of followers. She posted her first video in 2014 (Photo: Los Angeles Times/GETTY) 
Her first video - ‘sweet treats for the kids’ video - has had almost five million views. 
Since news broke on Tuesday evening, fans have been sending messages of support. Auntie Fee on The Steve Harvey Show (Photo: GETTY/NBCUniversal) 
After it was falsely reported by a number of US news outlets that she had died following the heart attack, a message was posted on her Facebook account asking for her followers to keep "praying". 
It said: “Auntie Fee is not dead, just keep praying y’all." Like us on Facebook
